oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1960-01-16 - Part 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 2 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from January 16, 1960. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), Porter Wagoner (host/performer) with Joyce Paul, guest performers Johnnie & Jack, and regular performers Archie Campbell, Tommy Jackson, Chet Atkins, Minnie Pearl, and Del Wood. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN. Johnnie & Jack mention the next day's benefit for Red Sovine in Louisville, KY. It is announced that this is the 1058th broadcast.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Minnie Pearl; Ray Price; Johnnie & Jack; Del Wood; Porter Wagoner; Joyce Paul
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Grant Turner introduces Minnie Pearl -- Comedy routine (Minnie Pearl) -- The Proof Is In The Puffing (Ray Price) (recording) -- Porter Wagoner introduces Johnnie & Jack -- Wild And Wicked World (Johnnie & Jack) -- Porter Wagoner introduces Del Wood -- Down By The Riverside (Del Wood) -- Grant Turner and Porter Wagoner talk -- The Girl Who Didn't Need Love (Porter Wagoner, Joyce Paul) -- Closing theme -- Closing statement (Porter Wagoner) -- Camel Cigarettes jingle -- Network announcements (Grant Turner)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); United States. Armed Forces Radio Service; Turner, Grant; Sloan, Ralph; Tennessee Travelers; Atkins, Chet; Wood, Del; Jackson, Tommy; Campbell, Archie; Minnie Pearl; Wagoner, Porter; Paul, Joyce (Vocalist); Johnnie & Jack; Wright, Johnnie, 1914-2011; Anglin, Jack, 1916-1963; Price, Ray, 1926-2013
